metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7089 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 is affected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers to conduct Universal XSS (UXSS) attacks via a crafted web site that is mishandled during parent-tab processing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.0-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.0-2').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
